title: Our rights are non-negotiable: indigenous groups go after Lula coalition amid veto vote
description:
With Congress set to analyze a presidential veto of a landmark indigenous land bill this week, Brazil’s Indigenous People Articulation (Apib) has launched a manifesto decrying the “anti-indigenous” sectors of the current governing coalition, affirming that traditional communities’ rights are “non-negotiable.” In September, pro-agro sectors of Congress pushed through a bill establishing the so-called “time-frame […]

The post Our rights are non-negotiable: indigenous groups go after Lula coalition amid veto vote appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Lula says he tried to avoid Africa being “taken hostage” by China
description:
President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva on Tuesday said Brazil developed close relationships with Africa during his previous terms as president (2003-2010) so the continent would not be “taken hostage” by China. The statement was a very rare dig by Lula at the country’s main trading partner. “We took Embrapa to Ghana,” the president said […]

The post Lula says he tried to avoid Africa being “taken hostage” by China appeared first on The Brazilian Report.

title: Brazil records its hottest temperature ever
description:
The small city of Araçuaí, in the southeastern state of Minas Gerais, recorded Brazil’s hottest temperature ever on Sunday, according to the National Institute of Meteorology (Inmet). Thermometers in the city reached 44.8ºC (112.6ºF), breaking a previous record set in 2005 in the city of Bom Jesus, in the northeastern state of Piauí. Araçuaí, situated […]

The post Brazil records its hottest temperature ever appeared first on The Brazilian Report.
